org.raistlic.common.stopwatch

Interface StopWatch


  • public interface StopWatch
    The interface simulates a stop watch. For single threaded (or equivalent environment) use only.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean expired(long currentNanos)
      Given the current system time stamp in nano seconds, return whether the current tick is expired.
      long getTick()
      Queries the current tick in nano seconds.
      void pause(long currentNanos)
      Pause the watch so that it no longer measures any more time elapsed.
      long readElapsed(long currentNanos)
      This method returns the amount of time elapsed (in nano seconds) since the latest marked start time, comparing with either the given currentNanos or the moment when the watch was paused, depending on whether the watch is running or being paused, respectively.
      long readExpired(long currentNanos)
      This method returns the amount of time expired (in nano seconds), based on the latest marked start time and tick amount, comparing with either the given currentNanos or the moment when the watch was paused, depending on whether the watch is running or being paused, respectively.
      void reset(long currentNanos)
      Set the specified current time as the marked start time; set the watch to be running.
      void resume(long currentNanos)
      Resume the watch so that it start measuring elapsed time again.
      void set(long expiresInNanos, long currentNanos)
      Sets the StopWatch's marked start time so that it will expire in expiresInNanos amount of time, regardless of whether the StopWatch is currently paused or not.
      void setTick(long tickNanos)
      Sets the tick in nano seconds.
      void tickBackward(long currentNanos)
      Change the marked start time backward by the amount of getTick() nano seconds, regardless of whether the StopWatch is paused or not.
      void tickForward(long currentNanos)
      Forward the marked start time by the amount of getTick() nano seconds, regardless of whether the StopWatch is paused or not.

    • Method Detail

      • setTick

        void setTick(long tickNanos)
        Sets the tick in nano seconds. A tick is an amount of expiration time that's repeatedly used in the stop watch.
        Parameters:
        tickNanos - the tick in nano seconds, must be greater than 0 .
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when tickNanos is less than or equal to 0 .

      • getTick

        long getTick()
        Queries the current tick in nano seconds.
        Returns:
        the current tick of the StopWatch in nano seconds.

      • tickForward

        void tickForward(long currentNanos)
        Forward the marked start time by the amount of getTick() nano seconds, regardless of whether the StopWatch is paused or not.
        Parameters:
        currentNanos - the current system time stamp in nano seconds.

      • tickBackward

        void tickBackward(long currentNanos)
        Change the marked start time backward by the amount of getTick() nano seconds, regardless of whether the StopWatch is paused or not.
        Parameters:
        currentNanos - the current system time stamp in nano seconds.

      • expired

        boolean expired(long currentNanos)
        Given the current system time stamp in nano seconds, return whether the current tick is expired.
        Parameters:
        currentNanos - the current system time stamp in nano seconds.
        Returns:
        true if the current tick is expired.

      • set

        void set(long expiresInNanos,
         long currentNanos)
        Sets the StopWatch's marked start time so that it will expire in expiresInNanos amount of time, regardless of whether the StopWatch is currently paused or not. If paused, the StopWatch will expire in expriresInNanos nano seconds after it's resumed. Notice that the method does not change the watch's tick amount. Use negative expiresInNanos value to set the watch to an already-expired state.
        Parameters:
        expiresInNanos - the amount of time in nano seconds, that the StopWatch will expire in.
        currentNanos - the current system time stamp in nano seconds.

      • readElapsed

        long readElapsed(long currentNanos)
        This method returns the amount of time elapsed (in nano seconds) since the latest marked start time, comparing with either the given currentNanos or the moment when the watch was paused, depending on whether the watch is running or being paused, respectively. See also reset(long).
        Parameters:
        currentNanos - the current system time stamp in nano seconds.
        Returns:
        the amount of time elapsed in nano seconds, can be negative value in case the marked start time is some time in the future.

      • readExpired

        long readExpired(long currentNanos)
        This method returns the amount of time expired (in nano seconds), based on the latest marked start time and tick amount, comparing with either the given currentNanos or the moment when the watch was paused, depending on whether the watch is running or being paused, respectively.
        Parameters:
        currentNanos - the current system time stamp in nano seconds.
        Returns:
        the amount of time expired in nano seconds, can be negative value in case the watch is not expired.

      • reset

        void reset(long currentNanos)
        Set the specified current time as the marked start time; set the watch to be running.
        Parameters:
        currentNanos - the current system time stamp in nano seconds.

      • pause

        void pause(long currentNanos)
        Pause the watch so that it no longer measures any more time elapsed.
        Parameters:
        currentNanos - the current system time stamp in nano seconds.

      • resume

        void resume(long currentNanos)
        Resume the watch so that it start measuring elapsed time again.
        Parameters:
        currentNanos - the current system time stamp in nano seconds.
